summary:
Originally an electrical engineer, I have shifted through various fields over the years. After studying multidisciplinary engineering subjects in a combined Bachelor and Master's Program at the University of Patras in Greece, I specialised in Electric Power Systems and Control. Then I moved to the Netherlands and the Eindhoven University of Technology, where I acquired my second Master's degree in Systems and Control.

During my studies I did my internship in Preceyes, a medical robotics company and my MSc thesis at Aris, a computer vision company. My master thesis was about automatic flower counting from partial detections and the continuation of my work led to a publication in Computers and Electronics in Agriculture (Elsevier).

Afterwards I worked for 2.5 years as a robotics engineer in the automotive sector (TNO automotive), where I was responsible for the development of algorithms for advanced driver-assistance systems. Other responsibilities were integration and testing in instrumented vehicles, involvement in European research projects as well as interaction with clients and technical knowledge transfer.

Currently I am working on automated guided vehicles, as an embedded software engineer at Lely. Among my responsibilities are the development of robotic algorithms for barn and feeding solutions, mentorship of junior colleagues as well as being in contact with the field farms for root cause analysis and solution of blocking issues. Being involved and interested in Agile software development, I had a short tenure as a Scrum master in a software team, where I helped cultivating an environment of self-management and transparency and improving the team's way of working.

I am particularly enthusiastic about clean code principles and design patterns, which I try to apply during software development and inspire my peers about them as well.

In my free time, as part of personal projects, I have worked in web application development, mostly on the front-end side.

projects.title: MeBeSafe
projects.description:
This project focused on the generation of static hazards, hence hazards originating from possible dangers based on the current location and historic traffic data, as well as dynamic hazards, hence dangers originating from dynamic objects around the instrumented vehicle. The intention is to nudge the driver towards these hazards so that the can adjust his speed accordingly in order to avoid an accident. In this case, this nudge is visual and is being broadcasted via an HMI (Human-Machine Interface).

In this project I have participated as part of the TNO partner.

projects.title: Autonomous navigation through a maze using a holonomic robot
projects.description: The robot (PICO) has to navigate autonomously through an unknown maze, containing loops, dead ends and a door. The robot must not touch or bump into the walls and it has to 'ring' a bell at the door, in order to go through. The door cannot be avoided as it is in way of the only exit. Finally there is a set time limit, in which the robot must find the exit of the maze. The software is developed in C++.

contributors.headline: Design Engineer - Robotics/Mechatronics Software, Embedded Systems

projects.title: Modelling and control of a three-tank hybrid system
projects.description: A three-tank-system is a multiple input multiple output (MIMO) system, being composed by two inputs and three outputs. The system is modelled and simulated in Simulink/Matlab. Three controllers, namely a PI, an LQR and a MPC controller are designed and tested on the setup. Finally, the performance of the three controllers is compared based on a number of properties.

contributors.headline: PhD (cum laude) in Data-driven modeling | Masters in Systems and Control | MBA

projects.title: Synthesis of a robust servo controller for a hard disk drive
projects.description: The model of a hard disk drive is a multiple input multiple output (MIMO) system. Its nominal plant is simulated in Matlab and parametric and dynamic uncertainties are inserted in it. Shaping filters defining several specifications are designed and are implemented into the plant. Finally, a robust H∞ controller is designed and its stability against uncertainties is evaluated.

projects.title: Distributed control of concurrent mechatronic agents – Intelligent traffic intersection
projects.description: In the intelligent traffic intersection, cars drive on a traffic crossing without traffic signs, but coordinating their driving via mutual communication. Firstly, the Domain Specific Language (DSL) that the agents use to communicate is created and then the system architecture of the cooperating agents is established.  Event stream communication is used for individual agents to exchange event messages through a bus, upon which a Life Cycle State Machine (LCSM) is built. This machine is the discrete coordination between all involved Car agents, which is coordinated by a Central agent. Furthermore, the single-agent behaviour is modelled in a way to resemble real-life conditions (changing weather conditions) and finally a graphical interface is created, so that the user can interact with the system. The software is developed in Python and C++.

contributors.headline: Senior Mechanical Design Engineer at ACE Development & Engineering
Software Architect Retina Robotics at Carl Zeiss Meditec AG

projects.title: Finite element analysis – Heat conduction problem
projects.description: The heat conduction problem on a square domain with a circular exclusion is considered. The goal of the analysis is to compute the temperature field on the given domain, where a Galerkin Finite Element discretisation is used. Furthermore, a routine which enables the computation of multiple mesh refinements is implemented in Python.

projects.title: Molecular dynamics – Grain silo
projects.description:
The motion of grains in a silo can be simulated with a discrete particle model. In this
model, the grains are represented by particles with a certain mass. The forces that act on
these particles are gravity and the elastic and viscous forces due to the contact with
neighbouring particles. The new position and velocity of each particle is determined by means
of the Verlet explicit time integration scheme. In order to reduce the simulation time of the process, a new cell algorithm is implemented. The idea behind this algorithm is that for sufficiently large cell dimension, it can be assumed that a particle only interacts with the other particles in the cell and the particles in neighbouring cells. In this way the number of evaluations in particle interaction routine is reduced significantly and thus the computation time is much smaller. The software is developed in C.

projects.title: Accurate positioning of two connected rotating masses attached to a DC-motor
projects.description: The experimental setup consists of two rotating masses, connected with a flexible joint. Each mass is connected to an incremental encoder. One mass is connected to a DC-motor (co-located mass) and the goal is to accurately position the second (non co-located) mass. The dynamics of the system are computed through frequency response measurements (FRF) and a feedback and a feedforward controller are designed. Finally the performance of the controllers is evaluated. The software is developed in Matlab/Simulink and the EtherCAT fieldbus system is used for the implementation.

contributors.headline: Data Engineer bij DAF Trucks NV

projects.title: Analysis and Development of the control technique of a Permanent Magnet Motor for Small Electric Vehicles (MSc thesis)
projects.description: A permanent magnet synchronous motor is controlled with a variation of the Direct Torque Control (DTC) method. The system is simulated in Simulink/Matlab to evaluate the performance of the control technique. Furthermore, a microcontroller dsPIC30F4011 of Microchip is programmed and a printed circuit board (PCB) is designed in KiCad and manufactured for the implementation of the algorithm.

projects.title: Installation of surge arresters on a residence
projects.description: The lighting protection of a house is designed, with emphasis on the grounding and the collector system, as well as the cathode conductors.

contributors.headline: R&D Engineer in Smart Grid Technologies
MSc in Electrical and Computer Engineering

projects.title: Motion simulation and trajectory planning of a 4 DOF RRRP robotic arm in Matlab
projects.description: A 4 DOF RRRP robotic arm is simulated in Matlab. The problems of forward and inverse kinematics are solved and a circular trajectory of the end effector is planned. The dynamic equations of motion are computed and finally the required generalised forces for the desired trajectory are calculated.

projects.title: Localisation of small robotic vehicles (amigobots) in a known environment
projects.description: The position and orientation of robotic vehicles inside a restricted environment are estimated based on measurements from their sonars. The least squares method is used for this estimation problem and finally the predicted trajectory is compared with the measured one from the encoders of the robotic vehicle. The software is developed in Matlab.

projects.title: Teleoperation and motion control of a 3 DOF RRR robotic arm (LARrobot)
projects.description: The forward and inverse kinematics of a 3 DOF RRR robotic arm are computed and the response of the system is measured and compared with the theoretical. The parameters of the PID controller of the robotic joints are tuned for optimal performance. The software is developed in Matlab.

profile_positions.title: Robotics Researcher

profile_positions.description:
MSc Thesis - Automated flower counting from partial detections

Description: 
Flowers are tracked through images taken from multiple views. This is achieved by solving the data association problem based on the flower detections by using Multiple Hypothesis Tracking. In this way, tracking through occlusions is possible, double counting is avoided and errors of the detection algorithm can be corrected. The software is developed in C++ using the ROS middleware.

Achievements:
•	Development of a counting software with promising experimental results
•	Improvement of the counting accuracy, with respect to the original counting method of Aris
•	Co-authorship of a paper for Computers and Electronics in Agriculture September 2021 - link below
profile_positions.title: Graduate

profile_positions.location: TU/e Robotics Lab, Eindhoven Area, Netherlands
profile_positions.description:
Calibration of the measurement window of an optical coherence tomography (OCT) probe

Description:
The static OCT reference stage of the Preceyes surgical system is redesigned by using a suitable motor. The resulting moving stage is controlled using Simulink and the EtherCAT fieldbus system.

Achievements:
•	Delivered a working setup with promising experimental results
•	Contributed to the enhancement of precision and safety during eye surgery
